description: From analgesia (“absence of pain”) +‎ -ic, from New Latin, from Ancient Greek ἀν- (an-, “without”) + ἄλγησις (álgēsis, “sense of pain”), from ἄλγος (álgos, “pain”).

adjectives.description: analgesic (comparative more analgesic, superlative most analgesic)

definitionGroups.group: (pharmacology) Of or relating to analgesia; anodyne.

entries.meaning: (of medicine) Acting to relieve pain; being an analgesic.
(of a person, etc) Unable to feel pain.
examples: With the exception of the foot and a small area over the malar bone, the entire left side of the body is analgesic and anaesthetic. This extends to the exact median line of the body, including the left half of the tongue, nose and chin,  […]

entries.meaning: (pharmacology) Any medicine, such as aspirin, that reduces pain, especially without inducing a loss of other sensation. (Contrast anesthetic.)
examples: Incline makes Ionsys, a potential analgesic for adult inpatients requiring opioid pain treatment after surgery.
